A 40-year-old woman is diagnosed with Primary adrenal insufficiency (Addison disease). Which of the following patient education recommendations should be addressed to avoid an acute adrenal crisis EXCEPT:
a-Always carry identification (eg, medical alert bracelet) listing the diagnosis.
b- Take corticosteroid supplementation as directed and do not abruptly stop treatment.
c- Advice all treating health care professionals that he has a diagnosis of chronic adrenal insufficiency
d-Supplemental dosing of glucocorticoid as may be required during an acute illness, including infections, surgery, even fever
e-The reduction in excess pigmentation is the only clinical marker
